inn1.comm: good start! Almost gets a yorker through Tamim first ball but he just manages to get the bat down in time. Took him by surprise?
pushed across on the angle outside off, holds his bat inside the line and the ball bounces twice through to Buttler
back of a length outside off, defended with a slightly open face to backward point
gets across onto off stump and works a length delivery to the left of mid-on
early boundary again, the off side this time, takes advantage of a hint of a width with a lovely square drive
straightens the line, full at off stump, a slower delivery which is pushed to mid-off
full at off stump, hint of swing away, comes forward and defends
full outside off, onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
takes a stride to the off side and tucks a straight delivery through midwicket
this swings quite late, a full length outside off, Imrul hanging back a little in the crease and it sides off the face to backward point
back of a length, he makes a late decision to leave alone as this again moves late...reaches Buttler at waist height
this one is full enough to bring him into the time, struck quite nicely but picks out cover
back of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to mid-off
cramps him for room with a length ball at off stump which Tamim tries to cut...a risk of dragging that on
full at middle and off, rolled his fingers across the ball, pushed into midwicket
shorter, he leans back and cuts into the off side
short of a length on the hip, flicked to long leg
full at middle off, pushed back to the bowler
well bowled, Tamim used his feet and Willey responded by banging the ball in short which the batsman had to fend at...takes the glove to the leg side
full, wide, swinging away and it defeats a flat-footed swipe
chases a wide one again, reaching a long way from his body, takes the bottom edge as scoots wide of the stumps
length ball angling in at off stump, defended at the top of the bounce to cover
a touch fuller, Tamim comes onto the front foot, defends to cover
fiddling for this outside off, looks a touch uncertain, but the ball goes safely to backward point
think that was another cutter, full at off stump, takes a thick inside part of the bat down to long leg
short of a length at off stump, he tries to rock back to enable him to cut but picks out point
this is excellent from Woakes, goes fuller this time, Tamim is through his drive early and the ball dribbles back to the bowler...you can feel he's getting frustrated
short ball, he brings out the pull, doesn't really middle it, comes high off the bat, Moeen at square leg parries the ball away
trying to make something happen, backs away outside leg, it's an off-cutter slower ball and it beats the top edge through to Buttler. Smart bowling
that's a release for Imrul and Bangladesh, Woakes drops it short again and he swivels very nicely on a well-controlled pull...no deep square in place
a sweetly-timed punch off the pads as Willey gets too straight
full outside off, Imrul ends up with his feet outside off stump as he taps towards point
full outside off, driven to cover
angled in at off stump on a full length, flicked through square leg
that's a superb stroke, a spanking straight drive from Tamim...full at off stump, and he sends it straight back from where it came
dropped, but it would have been a blinder at point! He pushed it wider outside off, Tamim chases it with a square drive it clipped the fingers of point, Jason Roy, who was horizontal as he dived
length ball outside, might have been another cutter, defended with an open face
is this a catch? No, it's taken the thigh pad as Tamim pulls, a short-of-a-length ball, Buttler runs around and takes a good 'catch' and they've run a leg bye in the time it was in the air
pushed into midwicket
a sharp bouncer over off stump, skims over the top edge as Imrul goes for the hook

big top edge, finds deep square! Superbly thought out wicket from England, they had just tweaked the leg-side field, Woakes sent down a short ball and Imrul obliges by pull straight down Willey's throat. Lazy from the batsman, smart from the bowler
full at off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, nips back at Tamim, played off the back foot to cover
pushed very wide outside off, full as well, Tamim reaches for it and it comes off the bottom of the bat to cover
that's a punchy drive on the up into a tightly-packed off side field, cover is deep enough to allow the single
short of a length on leg stump, tucked off his hip to short fine leg
full, pushed across outside off, left alone and this scuttles through to the keeper
short of a length at the body, punched with plenty of bottom hand to square leg
short again, he's angry with himself as he drags it to square leg without any timing
fuller, flicked from outside off into the leg side...pressure continues to build on Tamim
short ball works again! Very clever bowling from Woakes. Inviting Tamim to play the pull, he does so, can't keep the ball down and couldn't have picked out midwicket any better
a lovely piece of timing to get off the mark, although it wasn't a million miles from the leg tap again, angled into the pads and flicked with strong bottom hand through square leg
gets onto off stump, defended to cover
full and off stump, still giving it a chance to swing, driven firmly off the front foot and Willey then boots it to midwicket
pushed across outside off, holds its line, left alone
short of a length outside off, drags his pull to mid-on
fuller, at off stump, he comes forward and defends to cover
back of a length, he moves across his crease a little and plays into midwicket
can't take advantage of a ball on leg stump as he flicks it straight to short fine leg...first maiden of the innings
short of a length outside off, angled down to third man
banged in short again, he charges down the pitch and tries to heave this through the leg side...doesn't make contact
fuller, at off stump, flicks towards midwicket where the fielder can't quite stop it with a dive to his left
gets inside the line and flicks a length ball to deep square
back of a length outside off, defended to the covers
short outside off, he lets it through the keeper...fairly close to a wide but he gets away with it
gets a leading edge which loops wide of backward point, was trying to work a short of a length delivery into the leg side...trouble by a touch of extra bounce
this delivery zips through short of a length outside off, angled across and defeats Sabbir's attempt to cut
short of a length on leg stump this time, he tries to flick it away but it just balloons into the leg side
a loopy bouncer, and this one is too far over the batsman's head
fuller, at the stumps, defended carefully to the leg side
short ball, rolls his wrists on the pull down to long leg
fuller, on the stumps, flicked in the air for a little while but falls short of midwicket
on the pads, pushed to midwicket with a straight bat
full at off stump, nice flight, comes forward and pushes to long-off
dragged down short outside leg, he goes for the pull but the ball just dribbles off the bottom edge to short fine leg
goes back in the crease to a shortish ball, takes the pad to the leg side...he's really struggling to get the ball away

a googly, not sure he picked it, but it was quite short so he was able to play it off the pitch to deep midwicket...then there was almost confusion in the running as Mahmudullah started to race back for a second that wasn't on
presses forward and defends
excellent work at mid-on by Rashid, Sabbir charging down the pitch at Ball's first delivery, it's back of a length, he heaves it to the right of mid-on

dragged on! Second ball for Jake today. Sabbir's struggle is over. Back of a length, bounced more than he expected, plays it down off a bottom edge into the stumps. Very similar to how Mosaddek fell in the first match
edged! But wide of the lone slip. Sparring at a length ball outside off, gets a thick edge which may well have carried to a second slip but goes fine of third man
fuller, comes nicely into the front foot and that's a lovely bit of timing through the off side as he threads the gap between cover and mid-off
responds by dragging the length, this nips in at Mushfiqur off the seam, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
wide outside off, his eyes light up and he throws his bat at it...the ball flies through to Buttler
full at middle and off, defended on the front
dragged down a touch short outside off, played to the covers
nicely bowled, touch slower, grips a little and turns, takes the front pad
stretches forward outside off, slides off a thick outside edge through short third man
goes back and defends to the off side
gives this more air, ends up being a low full toss which is pushed down the ground to bring up Bangladesh's fifty. It's been hard work
angled down to third man
full outside off, delivered from a touch wider on the crease, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on his toes square of the wicket
lovely delivery! This bounces and nips away outside off, it was actually a cutter that grip, lifts past the outside edge as Mushfiqur spars at it
touch fuller, defended to the off side...splice-jarring stuff from Ball
takes advantage of some width, cuts square through the off side to give deep point some work
floated up on leg stump, Mahmudullah leans forward to defend
slightly short, rocks back and clubs over the leg side, YJB thrums around the boundary in the deep to keep them to two
tossed up higher, think that's the googly, clips the inside edge as Mahmudullah plays forward
pushed through slightly short outside off, steered off the back foot through point
quicker, the legbreak straightening outside off, punched past extra cover to long-off... and that's 4000 ODI runs for the Mighty Atom. Could do with making it to at least 4050 here
shortish, at the body and tapped down to the leg side
back of a length, 84mph outside off, Mahmudullah swings hard and misses
takes the pace off, a cutter in the channel, steered through the covers
touch shrot and leg side, Mushfiqur deflects one off the hip
comes forward and strokes a single to deep extra cover
another slower ball to finish, prodded to extra cover
flighted, outside off, inviting Mahmudullah forwards, he cashes in with a wristy spank through extra cover
tossed up and pushed back down the ground
gives it some air, Mushfiq pats it away into the off side
legbreak straightening on the stumps, Mushfiq is down early and paddles to leg
floated up and punched through the covers to the sweeper

full toss from Rashid, swatted away through midwicket, Vince slides on the boundary and attempts to flick it back but the ball hits his trailing hand as he makes contact with the rope - so Sam Billings' back-up effort to prevent four is ruled in vain
shortish outside off, stabbed into the covers
drops short, taking the pace off but Mahmudullah picks it early, swings a pull handsomely away over midwicket to an untended part of the field
fullish outside off, gets on to the front foot and steers a couple into the deep
full outside off and pushed to extra cover
Balls sends down a cutter, quite wide of the stumps, punched into the off side
slightly back of a length in the channel, 84mph and driven in front of square
floats up another full toss, wide of the stumps and Mushfiq flaps it off the toe of the bat past extra cover
tossed up and punched back past the bowler
pushed through flatter outside off, steered to cover
gives it some air, Mushfiq uses the feet and drives one through the covers this time
flighted, steps out and steers another single down the ground
full and straight from Rashid, whipped to leg but can't beat the man at midwicket
slower ball outside off, prodded towards cover
slightly back of a length, Mahmudullah gets this in front of deep cover off the back foot for a couple
shortish, stabbed towards point from the crease
good length, 86mph arrowing in over off stump, shows it a straight bat
another cutter, outside off and dabbed towards short third man... That's the fifty stand between these two, at pretty much a run a ball

short, Mushfiq top-edges the pull... and Moeen takes a superb tumbling catch running in from fine leg! Ball has another, he's rolling on, an excellent start to his international career. Mushfiq remains in the doldrums, despite a valuable stand
floated up outside leg, prodded away
flighted on middle and off, Mahmudullah remains watchful
full on middle and leg, dug out to the leg side
pushed through outside off, nicely played, late off the back foot behind point and they get back for two
tossed up and driven in front of square, again Mahmudullah charges back
comes forward and pushes towards cover
slightly leg side, flicked through backward square to get off the mark
comes across and turns a length ball to leg
back and across and runs one to third man
dug in short, climbing too high for the umpires' liking
angled across from over the wicket, Shakib drops back and steers to backward point
oh, nearly drags on! Shakib dangles his bat out and gets a thick bottom edge, perilously close to off stump
pushed across with the arm, stays back and guides the ball towards backward point
tossed up on the stumps and Mahmudullah is down early to lap the ball away fine, Ball has to give chase and he manages to prevent it running all the way for four
comes forward and pushes down the ground to mid-off
flatter outside off, Shakib prods into the covers
pushed down the leg side, behind the pads for an extra
tossed up on the stumps, Shakib flicks a single through midwicket
full and flighted, worked short into the leg side
pushed through outside off, comes forward and drives into the deep for one
length outside off, Mahmudullah reaches for it, gets a thick outside edge... but it runs away for four to third man, taking him to a spunky fifty. Well played, that man
tighter to off stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
pitched up and driven through the covers for a single
slightly leg side, back of a length, tapped away
stays in the crease and blocks on off stump
fullish, 134kph/82mph, punched without a great deal of timing to mid-off
floated up on the stumps, Mahmudullah strokes one down the ground through mid-on
drags this one short, some turn but Shakib can watch it on to the bat as he cuts through cover point
pushed through, this one pretty much goes straight on, past the outside edge as he hangs back
flat on the stumps, worked through square leg for one

round the wicket, fired in on off, Shakib dabs in front of square and sets off before being sent back... should be a run-out but Billings' throw is wild and Shakib gets back! Just needed a moment to relay it with control to the keeper but Butter was left with too much to do
comes forward and pokes into the covers, this time he doesn't set off
dug in short by Stokes, pulled down in front of deep midwicket
full and in the channel, lets this one through to the keeper
did his roll his fingers over this one...? top of off and it bounces a bit more to hit the splice
presses forward on, blocked into the covers
length in the channel, goes back and opens the face, steered to third man

leg side, Shakib flicks at it, Buttler dives to take... gone, off the glove! Poor way to get out but England will take it, Stokes in particular, he was just looking for a glance off the hips - actually, he then tried to pull out and leave - but managed to tickle it through
tossed up, spinning in on the stumps, worked to leg
tossed up and defended into the off side
on the stumps, bit of extra bounce and Mahmudullah gloves to the leg side
angled in with the arm, Mahmudullah blocks on the stumps
works this to leg, can't get it behind square and has to go back
tossed up on middle stumps, this is glanced through backward square to keep Mahmuddulah on strike
banged in short, 135kph and pulled through midwicket with control
slightly short outside off, defended down towards backward point
shuffles into line and defends short into the off side
on the stumps, goes across and taps to the leg side
slower ball from Stokes, presses on to the front foot and smothers it
touch shorter, over off stump, blocked back down the track - just one off the over, Bangladesh having to rebuild again
flat offbreak on the stumps, Mahmudullah breaks the wrists and turns square for one
floated up full on off, played back to the bowler
floated up, comes forward and tickles back past the bowler for his first run to long-on
pushed through quicker on off, drops his bat on it in time
turned off the legs behind square, the fielder again prevents one
flat outside off, chopped to extra cover off the back foot... another quiet over
good length, 86mph/138kph, beats the bat as Mosaddek feels for it
the cutter this time, again past the outside edge as the batsman pushes forward
three in a row! That was a good ball, in fairness, nipping away past the groping bat
length on the stumps and turned to leg
touch shorter, 80mph and bouncing up as Mosaddek fends it down towards square leg
full outside off, steered to backward point, who takes the catch and looks quizzically at the umpires... bump ball
pushed through on the stumps and nudged back on the leg side
goes with the turn and gets a single away through backward square
tossed up, Mosaddek reaches for it and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side for a couple
turning in and he wristily tickles the ball fine, gets it past leg slip and runs away for a first boundary in a good while
tossed up and played back down the track
floated up on the stumps and nudged to the leg side
comes forward to a length ball and gets a thick inside edge into his pad which then loops to the leg side but short of midwicket
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full at middle and off, flicked to midwicket
just loses his line, glances fine of the keeper but Moeen does terrific work around the boundary to cut it off
angled onto leg stump again, fuller, clipped to deep square
short outside off, he can't beat cover as cuts off the back foot
delicate reverse dab to a ball outside off, short third man is able to get around
flicked from outside off to midwicket
works this one squarer so finds the gap
plants his front front across onto off stump then works his behind square on the leg side
draws him forward with a full one outside off, driven to cover
the attacking line outside near brings reward as this comes off a leading edge as he tries to work to leg, but just goes out of reach on Moeen's left
strongly pulled, didn't try to keep it down, falls well in front of deep square
that's comfortably his best stroke, a lovely on-the-up square drive which he plays wide of point and there's no one deep on the off side
and he gets back-to-back boundaries, although this one not as convincing, as he plays away from his body and gets a thick edge wide of the lone slip
back of a length, on off stump, defended to cover...think Stokes may be having the odd word
let down by a lack of footwork, he's stuck on leg stump and wafting at a full delivery outside off
driving away from his body but gets this one down to third man...and it's no-ball. Which the crowd go wild for
slower ball on off stump, he's through his leg-side swipe early and it trickles to short fine leg...good over for Bangladesh
that's very nice touch as he goes down early and paddle-sweeps it very fine, almost between Buttler's legs, and it races across the outfield
tucked from outside off into midwicket
beats him on the outside edge with a full ball that goes straight on
pushed to the leg side
driven to cover
flicked down to long-on so he'll keep the strike
full outside off, driven to cover
outside leg stump but he gets away with it as Mosaddek flicks to backward square leg
much more air on this one, a nice cover drive which almost defeats deep cover but Willey does well
dragged down very short, a real long hop, and he doesn't miss out - rocks back and crunches it over midwicket

gets back on a full length, an appeal for lbw, and he's gone to a review. Mosaddek playing around it a little, but was there an edge? Yes, it's massive edge. Clunked it into his front pad. Amazed Rashid didn't see that. The umpire did. Moving on
that grips and bounces, rips past the outside edge...Bangladesh's spinners won't mind seeing that
worked into midwicket
short outside off, flicked to midwicket
takes a leading edge to the off side
can't work this one into space, just rolls back down the pitch
finds the bowler again as he tries to flick it away with his bottom hand
manages to find a gap this time as he works it wide of the bowler down to long-on
full on middle, he props forward
touch shorter, allows him to go back and whip it off his pads to deep midwicket
gets the sweep away, takes a fair amount of top edge but it is well clear of any of the fielders as it skims away through backward square

given this time! Trying the deft paddle-sweep again. Initially he was walking straight off but he has called the review. He was so angry with himself did he just forget about the review? He must know he hasn't hit it. Fairly close to the glove. It's hit the inside of the front pad so looks in line. Snicko confirms no glove involved. It's smashing into middle and leg
very full and wide, greets it with a flowing cover drive...bit of a freebie first ball from Rashid
straighter, shorter, played off the back foot to mid-on
flicked down the ground to long-on
sharp turn and bounce, spins in at Nasir and it bounces off his body with no one quite sure where it's gone
driven off a thick edge to short third man
goes back and across, worked to the leg side
outside off, grips a little, prodded to the off side
works with the turn and takes this off his pads behind square on the leg side...fumble from Duckett in the deep but not costly as the two was pretty safe
patted to the off side
very full and wide, called wide
dragged down short, Mosaddek gets underneath it and doesn't quite middle the pull which allows deep midwicket to get round
width again, sliced in the air but short of backward point

this time the short ball strikes! Dragged down (bowled for and got?) Mosaddek rocks back, pulls in the air again, and picks out Adil's big mate Moeen at cow corner. What a way to go. Rubbish gets wickets in one-day cricket
tossed up outside off, driven towards cover where Roy can't stop it cleanly
sharp spin outside off, left alone, and that ends Rashid's work with the ball...he's nabbed himself a couple
that's a wonderful strike, sharp footwork down the pitch then a lovely, clean swing through the line deposits the ball over long-off
shorter, flatter, worked to backward square
beats the outside edge with a wider delivery outside off. Buttler doesn't glove it
beaten by some turn, takes him on the thigh pad and bobbles down by his feet
on off stump, blocked down the pitch
two in the over! This time he drags it a little and goes over long-on...perhaps not quite as clean as the first, but goes a long way.
beats the edge first ball back with a full one pushed across outside off
comes forward and drives to cover
touch shorter, Nasir waits for it and glides down to third man
a slower ball, full on off stump, he drives and spoons it in the air just wide of cover

a slower short ball, he connects well with his pull but a direct hit by Roy's throw from deep midwicket could have found Mashrafe short...yes, he would have been well out and the throw wasn't far from the stumps
another cutter, outside off, runs it down to third man
angles his first ball at the pads and gets clipped to deep square
moves outside leg then defends a short-of-a-length ball to cover
slower ball, into the pitch, he's through his pull early and gets taken on the hip
short again and somehow he manages to swat this way through the line while taking his eye off the ball...then he's gifted a boundary as Bairstow makes a hash of it at deep midwicket
unconventional again as this time he pulls a short ball straight down the ground, Bairstow manages to cut this one off running round from long-on
goes full, follows him outside leg stump, heaved to deep square...a little captain's innings here
gives himself room outside leg then gets a bottom edge as he swings across the line...through to Buttler
slanted across outside off and the umpire says that's too wide...looked a tad harsh, perhaps
clubs a back-of-a-length ball to mid-off
clears long-on! Swings hard at a short ball, it didn't look as though he'd got enough of that - it was a slower ball - but it just kept on going to creep over long-on
goes full and straight this time, cracked through the covers and wide of the sweeper for a couple...the crowd is jumping
that's a terrific strike, he's playing a blinder, he connects cleanly with a lofted drive to a full ball have just cleared his front leg a little
pressure tells on Willey as he flings this wide outside off...will have to bowl that again
full outside leg stump, he squeezes it out to deep midwicket and takes the strike which is perfect for Bangladesh
follows him with a full ball outside leg, drilled down to long-on and Nasir manages to get back for the second
a short delivery, he swings it one bounce to long-on
full outside off, a strong square drive which beats backward point and is wide of the cover sweeper
a slower ball, full and straight, nudged down to long-on...that's what he needs to do, feed the strike to the skipper
well bowled, a yorker outside leg stump, Mashrafe jabs it towards backward point
a short slower ball outside off, defeats Nasir as he tries to upper cut to third man
full, wide outside off, sliced to third man off a toe end
digs out a yorker towards long-on
a full toss outside off, carved through the cover and he's able to keep the strike
gives himself a touch of room outside leg then can't make contact with a full ball that skims past off stump
back of a length, swing and a miss as he tries to cart this over the leg side
gets this wrong, it's a big full toss outside off, launched over backward point but deep cover saves two...still, good over from Woakes
walks down the pitch, Ball may have seen him coming, sends the ball, it's a slower ball, and the batsman lets it go through
now he beats him with a full one outside off, more subtle changes of pace, swinging at fresh air...needs bat on ball
full toss outside off and this time he connects well, slices it behind point and wide of third man
that's brilliant batting, Ball went shorter and Nasir guided it wide of a diving Buttler with a lovely late dab
full, straight, worked to long-on
pinpoint yorker to finish with, Mashrafe can only play it back to the bowler
swings a length ball to long-off...over to the captain
a yorker outside off, squeezed square of the wicket
offers up a length delivery outside off, driven in the air over the covers...not out of the middle
a straight full toss, whipped through midwicket, confusion over the running but the throw is poor from the deep
moves to the leg side, tries to scoop a slower ball, slips down the leg side...Buttler underarms towards the stumps, hits direct, and he's found Mortaza short. Excellent skittles skills
dot ball to finish, Shafiul has a swing and miss. Starts to try and steal the bye, Buttler underarms again, misses, Shaiful gets back

inn2.comm: struck on the pads first ball, big appeal for lbw! Aleem Dar slowly shakes his head... Height the issue? Maybe a bit too much bounce, hit him above the knee roll hanging back
angled in, presses forward to defend this time
flighted a little wider, Roy reaches and taps into the covers
pushed through on the stumps and Roy squeezes a couple out through square leg
slower through the air, lots of excited noises as Roy prods forward in defence
darted on the stumps and Roy works this away in front of midwicket for a couple more. Disaster averted (for now)
trundles in and slings the ball down outside off at 76mph, Vince reaches and toe-ends it back towards the bowler
goes a bit straighter, no great shakes in the pace stakes, Mashrafe, but it's accurate and bunted to mid-on
length outside off, presses forward and dabs into the covers
angled in on the stumps, 74mph and clipped in front of square for Vince's first run
full outside off and Roy frees the arms, doesn't quite time a thrash down the ground and mid-on cuts it off

oh, what's Vince doing here... goes walkabout having clipped to midwicket and he would have been miles out if the throw was a direct hit. Never a run there, though it took Vince quite a while to spot that
sliding in, this nearly gets through... clips inside edge and then ricochets into pad as Roy pokes nervously

stumping appeal now, as Shakib drifts one past the outside edge! Did Roy have anything behind the line...? Yes, just about got his foot back, having been dragged forward by one that dipped in and turned. Testing moments, these
gets on to the front foot again and this time covers the line
angled in with the arm and Roy nurdles it through midwicket to get off strike
flighted, wide and inviting, Vince slices a drive, in the air... but in front of backward point and it bounces, skips and skedaddles away to the boundary
tossed up slower and straighter, on off stump and defended with a straight bat coming forwards
shortish on the stumps and helped away through square leg to the man in the deep
teasing line, bit of extra bounce as Vince dandles his bat in the channel and is beaten
closer to the stumps, waits in the crease and prods cautiously to point

full and gets him driving - gottim! Vince has already proven himself to be adept at losing control behind the wheel and he goes to a thick outside edge this time, steered on the up straight to backward point. Mashrafe nibbled the ball away and makes the first incision
fullish on the pads, tapped down into the leg side
swing for Mashrafe... but it's down the leg side
good length outside off, 76mph and dabbed down square - a near flawless over from Mashrafe, including the early wicket Bangladesh needed. Now for a few more?
tossed up outside off, Roy edges forwards and bunts one through mid-off
goes over the wicket, darted in on off stump, Duckett defends watchfully
fractionally straighter, turned to the on side from the crease
pushed through outside off, goes back and attempts to cut, doesn't get it away

bowled him, through the gate! A beauty from Shakib, the crowd erupts and Duckett is done for a duck! Wasn't to the pitch in trying to drive down the ground, left a gap and Shakib inveigled the ball inside the bat to hit the top of middle and leg stumps
tossed up on off, YJB leans into a steady front-foot block
Roy shuffles across on off and blocks... Needs to defuse the situation
length outside off, gets into line and guides the ball square
on the stumps, 76mph and a touch back of a length, stays back and shows it a straight bat
bit of width and Roy swings at it, comes off the toe of the bat into the covers and he has to run hard as the throw comes in at the non-striker's end
pitched up outside off, Bairstow punches to cover
tighter to the off stump and prodded defensively away
floats up a very full ball wide of the stumps and Roy has to reach to swat it down to long-off
skidding on with the arm, Bairstow props forward in defence
tossed up and this grips a fraction, clips the outside edge and runs through short third man for a couple
tossed up, Bairstow drives and Mashrafe leaps to take the ball in the covers, the crowd twitches into life at the catch but it was a bump ball
flighted outside off, comes forward and defends
tossed up and blocked coming forwards once again
slightly short over the stumps and blocked from the crease
slightly short and wide and Roy slaps a cut through cover point, won't quite run all the way
shortish, 125mph/77mph and Bairstow jumps into line to defend
arrowed in over the stumps, too straight and worked off the hip through midwicket for three more

full and straight, swing and miss, up goes the finger! Roy consults with Bairstow but, unless he hit it, that's as plumb as they come... no, he's walking off, England are three down! Mashrafe has both openers, Roy was getting frustrated, trying to release the shackles with a blow down the ground, beaten on the inside the ball rapped both pads - stone dead, hitting middle and leg according to Hawk-Eye
angled across in the channel outside off, Stokes stays in the crease and shoulders arms
skidding on, Bairstow plays back and shovels the ball away
tossed up and pushed into the covers leaning forwards
darted on off stump, again he gets forward to push it away
bit of turn on this delivery, comes off the outer half of the bat towards point
angled in a touch straighter and Bairstow hops back to flick through backward square leg
goes over the wicket, pushed through on off stump, Stokes blocks
trundles in on the stumps, clipped to leg and they scamper through as the throw comes in from midwicket
goes round the wicket to Stokes, who steps out to defend on off
slightly back of a length, 78mph/126kph and tapped down into the covers

bowled him, Stokes is gone! Mashrafe rattles the timber this time, don't know if it wobbled off the pitch but Stokes played all around it, trying to whip to leg and the ball was through him. The Tigers are tearing England limb from limb
starts a touch too straight and Buttler crunches a firm leg glance to the rope - only England's second boundary
comes forward early and works off his pads, towards midwicket but he was already accelerating down the pitch and makes the single comfortably
tossed up on leg stump and Buttler's down early to paddle away through backward square
drifting to the leg side again, YJB gets low and squirts it fine, looks like four until a brilliant dive on the rope prevents a boundary and save one. Bangladesh are up for this, no mistake

tossed up, Buttler reverses the hands and sweeps, straight to backward point, who throws it up in celebration... did that bounce? Shakib and the umpires seemed to think so but they eventually ask the third umpire to confirm. Yep, it bounced
uses the feet and punches through mid-off for one
tossed up on off, Bairstow leans out and defends
on the stumps, sliding on a touch too straight and YJB flicks a couple through backward square, haring back for the second
good length outside off, Buttler prods it back down the track
bangs the ball in short, 125kph and Buttler whirls his arms above his head like Budgie the Little Helicopter
short and straight and nudged forcefully off the body through midwicket for a couple this time
on the stumps and chopped down into the covers
touch short again, walks across and steers a back-foot punch down the ground
good length, slightly wide and taking the pace off, Buttler comes forward and pushes to extra cover
length outside off, YJB steers one through the covers
tossed up and Buttler is down low with the reverse-sweep, gets it through point for one
full on leg stump, sweeps powerfully and in orthodox fashion away through backward square leg for a rare boundary - England's third?
tossed up and driven down the ground through mid-off
steps out and misses with a whip to leg, thuds into the pad... but that was missing leg
tossed up and Buttler comes forward on off, again hits the pad and runs into the off side, this time they pinch a single - that's the 50, which is something of a recovery from 26 for 4
good length, Buttler steps out to drive and is beaten past the outside edge
not all that short but Buttler hammers a pull to the fence! Stepped out and pinged it, fast hands scything across the line, deep midwicket had no chance
comes forward and steers a length ball to mid-on
banged in short, over the head, too high
steps out and pushes a length ball into the covers
shortish and swatted in the air, will it carry to deep square leg... no, not quite! Excellent diving attempt but the ball landed just short
and here comes Buttler, through the off side this time, walking out menacingly and punched on the up, races away through the covers
short of a length outside off, drops back and glides one to third man
dug in, Buttler is ready for the short ball and pulls through square
good pace from Taskin, 134kph outside off, Bairstow opens the face and runs one more to third man
slightly short outside off, steered through point
short and wide and cracked off the back foot but there's a good diving stop at backward point to intercept Bairstow's cut
closer to the stumps, YJB drops back and dabs at it, fails to connect this time
back of a length outside off, Buttler walks at it and pushed to mid-off
down the pitch again, and across his stumps, works into midwicket
slower ball, full outside off, driven square to point
slides of the face to backward point
length delivery outside off, he uses his feet then pushes it to the left of mid-off
full, straight, Bairstow works across the line, closed face, but safely out to deep midwicket
full outside off, Bairstow chases it with a low cut, ball wasn't really short enough for the shot
full toss, punched into the off side, calls for a quick single and it's a direct hit! Could be close, but Bairstow is quick, stretches well, and he's home
short outside off, Buttler's power on show again as he plays a rasping pull stroke well in front of square
very short, way outside off as well, Buttler pulls out of his shot and it's called wide
keeps it short, and that's not working, gets dispatched through straight midwicket, along the ground with another crisp pull
what a shot! This is a short-arm swat-pull as he takes it from outside off and bunts it wide of mid-on...not clever from Taskin. Outstanding from Buttler
fuller, driven on the up out to deep cover
full outside off, he walks across his crease and flicks to mid-on
short of a length, angled in at Buttler, gets inside the line and works to long leg
width outside off, cut firmly towards point
better line, on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
beats him, a fuller length outside off, still a hint of nibble on offer
back of a length, pushed square to the off side
works a length ball to midwicket
through everything and everyone...basically a straight ball, it skidded on, Bairstow played around it, beat the inside edge, pad and the keeper's gloves
flicked to deep midwicket
uses his feet, flicks off his pads deep to the leg side
paddle-sweeps this from outside off to backward square leg
walks down the pitch and nudges to the leg side
full outside off, push and run towards mid-off...always scampering
full and wide, Bairstow throws his bat through the line, his bottom hand comes off the bat, backward point makes the save
a rare one he doesn't connect with as he swings across the line of a delivery quite wide outside off
that's sweetly timed, flicked firmly from outside off but straight to midwicket
down the pitch outside the line of off stump and then sends this down to long on
pulls a short ball, comes off top edge or splice, loops over midwicket inside the circle and falls into space
pushed down to long-on
plays with the turn wide of midwicket
flicked from outside off towards midwicket whose dive creates enough doubt over the single
goes for the reverse sweep and finds short third man
touch shorter, he goes back and punches towards midwicket where Shakib cuts it off again
worked through square leg and there speed of these two between the wickets makes it an easy couple
full outside off, he likes to take so much to the leg side, works this with a closed face behind square
at off stump, played back to the bowler
hint of shape back in at Bairstow who comes forward, traps it off a thick inside edge into his front pad
driven on the walk to mid-off, it's fairly tight but, again, so quick between the sticks and that's England's hundred up
back of a length, aims to the leg side, gets a bottom into his leg...fairly close to delicate area
short of a length outside off, pushed into the covers
down the pitch and flicks to midwicket
picks the gap this time, flicks it slightly squarer to beat the man inside the circle
straight delivery worked to square leg
plays back, a shorter delivery, turns a bit and is pushed to mid-on
flicked on the walk to midwicket
on leg stump, worked way behind square...ticking over is fine for England, required rate is not an issue
full at off stump, driven to mid-off who can't prevent the single
perhaps just hint of a shape in at the batsman, this is full at the stumps, punched to mid-on
he's done it! Taskin redeems himself, in some style. Length ball outside off, Bairstow went for a booming drive and gets a thin edge. That zipped off the surface. Nicely bowled
back of a length at off stump, defended square to point...slippery from Taskin
beats the edge! Goes fuller, outside off, tempts the drive from Moeen whose feet are quite moving yet
length at middle and off, defended to midwicket
worked off the pads round the corner to short fine leg
uses his feet, doesn't quite get to the pitch, but manages to adjust and somehow manages to time this through the leg side to the extent he gets four...incredible batting, that's his fifty
dragged down short, he goes back and flat-bats to long-on
round the wicket to the left hander, he presses forward, opens the face into point
pushed to midwicket
this keeps a little low as Buttler plays back, but he watches it closely and is able to place it down to long-on
that's a beauty! He's found something. Short of a length, jags away off the seam to beat Buttler's outside edge by some distance...good carry, too
moves across his crease and pulls a short ball (although it probably didn't pitch much differently to the previously deliver) and finds deep square
short, angling across Moeen who pulls it wide of mid-on
on a fuller length, defended to the bowler
short again, he's through his pull and gets taken on the hip then the ball deflects underneath Mushfiqur's gloves
on the pads, flicked to long leg
slides on with the arm, defended with bat and pad together

what a catch! Shakib has pulled off a brilliant grab. Looked a pretty horrid shot from Moeen, went to pull a slightly shorter delivery, was aiming over midwicket and it flies off the top edge into the off side. Shakib has to turn, run and take it over his shoulder with a dive. Superb.
full, flicked back to the bowler
touch shorter, drilled back past the bowler
goes back and pushes a shortish ball to long-on
fuller, eased down the ground

that could be the match! Huge appeal for lbw as Buttler moves across his crease and misses his flick. Not given on the field. They call for the review. Such a key wicket. Well, this is very close. Think it hit him in line. He's down the pitch a bit. He's not hit it. Three reds, he's gone!
full and straight, flicked down to long leg
goes for the drive, into the off side
full outside off, a flowing driven picks out cover
back of a length outside off, opens the face down to third man
full, wide, and driven beautifully through the off side, beats the cover ring
flicked into the leg side
comes forward and defends
worked into midwicket
full at the stumps, patted back to the bowler
bottom hand comes into play as he flicks to long-on
full and straight, dabbed to the off side
what a spell this is! On a good length at off stump, Woakes trying to run it down to third man and gets a healthy nick through to the keeper
huge appeal for lbw, full and straight, but did it pitch outside leg stump? They have gone for the review. Where it pitches is key. Yes, it's outside leg stump
slips down the leg side, Willey misses his flick
full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length outside off, opens the face to third man
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to cover
short, angled down the leg side, another wide
short of a length, gets on top of the bounce and drives to point
goes on with the arm, defended
patted to the covers
works a straight ball to the leg side
defended into midwicket
goes deep in the crease and flicks to square leg...he's rattling through this over
a tickle down the leg side as he gets a little too straight
pitched up around off stump, Willey prods to mid-off coming forwards
good length, angled across, plays this one squarer and picks up one
touch short outside off, Rashid stays back and clips in front of point
full outside off, 139kph/87mph, driven to point on the bounce
fullish, a slower ball, Willey dabs at it late and get a thin edge, Mushfiq takes it on the bounce
plants the front foot and pushes the ball towards mid-off
length ball, turning in and pops into the leg side off the thigh pad
pushed through outside off, Rashid drops back to cut and gets a bottom edge
on off stump, bit of extra bounce to hit the gloves as he blocks
waits in the crease and turns the ball to leg, Willey hesitated for a moment but gets home as the throw comes in
goes round the wicket, angled in and tapped away
floated up on the stumps, Willey nudges to the on side
over the wicket and angled in with the arm, Rashid flicks it fine
goes round the wicket, Willey comes across to defend
good length, comes forward and blocks, off the inside edge to leg
maybe taking some pace off, turned short into the leg side
over the wicket now, dug in short and Willey mullers a pull hard and flat through mid-on. That's why Bangladesh need to kill this off
stays a bit low, maybe a cutter, Willey jabs the toe of the bat down on it
on the stumps, flipped back down the ground, Rashid nudging and nurdling away
Willey leans on to the front foot and blocks
over the wicket,, floated up on off, Willey defends again
on the stumps, turns the ball to the leg side
goes over the wicket, dobbed on off stump, punched into the ground
sliding on with the arm, Willey flicks this one off his legs and races off, short fine leg fires in the throw but they were safely through for one
another cutter from Mashrafe, outside off and Willey swings hard, takes his bottom hand off the bat, edged into the turf through to the keeper
slower ball on leg stump, turned to leg
slightly back of a length, Willey nudges off his hip through square for one
off-stump line, Rashid watches it under his nose and defends
bit of width, Rashid drops back and steers a single to third man - that's the England 150, another small way-marker
taking the pace off again and Willey has to content himself with blocking back to the bowler
pushed through on off, Rashid comes across and prods away
leans into a solid forward defensive
darted on the stumps and Rashid comes forward and tickles one to long-on
goes round the wicket, flat on the stumps, Willey punches to long-on from the crease
tossed up and worked back past the bowler again
tight lines and Willey defends - that's a solid contribution from Nasir, 10-1-29-1
ooh, that stays very low, outside off and Rashid was nearer to playing it with his boot than his bat
comes forward on off and taps the ball in front of square
goes a bit straighter, Rashid whips one off his pads
angled across outside off, Willey swings and misses
fullish outside off, a slower cutter and it scoots through as Willey wafts at it
on the pads, can't get much of a connection on a tap to midwicket
on the stumps, too straight and wristily swished away through backward square for four
lobbed up, uses the feet and works through mid-on

big swing from Willey, struck on the back leg - that's out! Mosaddek gets among the wickets, Willey's patience had run out long ago, he was trying to launch this into Gulshan district but carved out a slice of fresh air to leave England nine down
tossed up from over the wicket, Ball prods at it
spinning in from outside off, clips the inside edge
pushed through flatter outside off, Ball goes back and is beaten
squares him up, Rashid gets a leading edge... but it lands a yard or two short of point
slightly back of a length outside off, Rashid glides it down to third man
shortish on the stumps, shuffles into line and flips his first run to the leg side
Rashid moves across on off stump and defends
good length, 130kph/80mph outside off, punched firmly to mid-off
on the stumps, worked away through backward square leg for one more
tossed up and launched! Very sexy inside-out lofted cover drive from Rashid, lands it right on the rope at deep extra cover for England's first six of the innings. Might be a bit late
darted on the stumps, worked into a gap at midwicket
pushed through outside off, pokes forward and gets a thick outside edge, which brings Ball on strike
tossed up outside off stump, goes for the big heave ho and fails to connect
Ball is looking to plant one in the stands, gets a bottom edge on this
big swing again and this time he under-edges between Mushfiq's legs for a couple
Rashid drops back and slides one more off the bat face to third man
dug in short, over the vertical blade as Ball swings across the line
pitched up and Ball gets hold of this, spanked back down the ground in the old-fashioned style for four
well-directed bouncer, at the throat as Ball limbos underneath
full outside off, slower ball, mistimed on the drive to cover
and that's why! Not quite all the way but Ball uses those long levers to send a meaty swat over extra cover, one-bounce four
tossed up and worked against the turn through mid-on
pushed through, did that take the edge? Yes, a big enough deflection to send it past Mushfiqur's gloves and running away for a couple
floated up and he carts the ball to leg this time, firmly struck and although it was stopped in front of the boundary, he then stepped on the rope to concede four
tossed up wide of the stumps and Ball broom-handles it through point
darted wide of the tramlines on the off side
tossed up on the stumps, worked through backward square leg
pushed through flat and wide of the stumps, Ball slaps it through point for one more
slightly back of a length outside off, Ball swings and misses
shortish and rising to jam the glove against the bat handle, punched down into the leg side
full outside off, Rashid carves through cover point coming forwards
slower ball from Taskin, does the batsman... but Ball just whacks through the line and sends it back down the ground, almost goes all the way!
slips in the yorker, full on off and Ball drops the bat, squeezes an outside edge past the keeper! Taskin has his hands on his head, he was beginning to appeal for lbw but it's four more!
fired in full on off stump and this time blocked towards point
full, possibly a cutter, Rashid leans out to block
good length, Rashid tries to roll his wrists on it, sends it back to the bowler
length on the stumps and worked away through backward square leg for one

full on the stumps, Ball slogs it up into the Dhaka night sky... taken running in off the boundary! Bangladesh have sealed the deal! Nasir held his nerve to swallow the chance, it was a cutter and too good for Ball. Captain Mashrafe punches the air, he's been the man with bat and ball today
